member.name: P:Intel.RealSense.PlaybackDevice.Realtime
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the playback works in real time or non real time
member.value: Indicates if playback is in real time mode or non real time
member.remarks: In real time mode, playback will play the same way the file was recorded. In real time mode if the application takes too long to handle the callback, frames may be dropped. In non real time mode, playback will wait for each callback to finish handling the data before reading the next frame. In this mode no frames will be dropped, and the application controls the frame rate of the playback (according to the callback handler duration).

member.name: T:Intel.RealSense.Config
member.summary: The config allows pipeline users to request filters for the pipeline streams and device selection and configuration.

member.name: T:Intel.RealSense.Pipeline
member.summary: The pipeline simplifies the user interaction with the device and computer vision processing modules.
member.remarks: The class abstracts the camera configuration and streaming, and the vision modules triggering and threading. It lets the application focus on the computer vision output of the modules, or the device output data. The pipeline can manage computer vision modules, which are implemented as a processing blocks. The pipeline is the consumer of the processing block interface, while the application consumes the computer vision interface.

member.name: M:Intel.RealSense.Pipeline.#ctor(Intel.RealSense.Context)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Intel.RealSense.Pipeline.Start
member.summary: Start the pipeline streaming with its default configuration.
member.remarks: Starting the pipeline is possible only when it is not started. If the pipeline was started, an exception is raised.
member.returns: The actual pipeline device and streams profile, which was successfully configured to the streaming device.

member.name: M:Intel.RealSense.Pipeline.Start(Intel.RealSense.Config)
member.summary: Start the pipeline streaming according to the configuraion.
member.param: A with requested filters on the pipeline configuration. By default no filters are applied.
member.returns: The actual pipeline device and streams profile, which was successfully configured to the streaming device.

member.name: M:Intel.RealSense.Pipeline.Start(Intel.RealSense.FrameCallback)
member.summary:
Start the pipeline streaming with its default configuration.
The pipeline captures samples from the device, and delivers them to the through the provided frame callback.
member.remarks: Starting the pipeline is possible only when it is not started. If the pipeline was started, an exception is raised. When starting the pipeline with a callback both or will throw exception.
member.param: Delegate to register as per-frame callback
member.returns: The actual pipeline device and streams profile, which was successfully configured to the streaming device.

member.name: M:Intel.RealSense.Pipeline.Stop
member.summary: Stop the pipeline streaming.
member.remarks: The pipeline stops delivering samples to the attached computer vision modules and processing blocks, stops the device streaming and releases the device resources used by the pipeline. It is the application's responsibility to release any frame reference it owns. The method takes effect only after was called, otherwise an exception is raised.

member.name: P:Intel.RealSense.Pipeline.ActiveProfile
member.summary: Gets the active device and streams profiles, used by the pipeline.
member.remarks: The method returns a valid result only when the pipeline is active
member.value: The actual pipeline device and streams profile, which was successfully configured to the streaming device on start.

member.name: T:Intel.RealSense.PipelineProfile
member.summary:
The pipeline profile includes a device and a selection of active streams, with specific profile.
The profile is a selection of the above under filters and conditions defined by the pipeline. Streams may belong to more than one sensor of the device.
